Accessibility: Generally wheelchair accessible near main ghats
Special Notes: One of the most sacred sarovars in Hindu tradition

Accessibility: Paths and steps in temple areas — partial wheelchair access
Nearby Amenities: Small stalls, tour operators in Kurukshetra town
Special Notes: Site associated with Krishna’s recitation of the Bhagavad Gita to Arjuna

Wikipedia: Not a dedicated Wikipedia page for the centre
Accessibility: Road-accessible from Kurukshetra town; on-site ramps likely
Guided Tours: School & group tours common; local guides available on request
Special Notes: Houses panoramic displays and exhibits on Mahabharata and local heritage

Accessibility: Well-laid paved paths and terraces; some steps between terraces
Hilly roads; limited wheelchair access in viewpoints
Guided Tours: Local guides and trekking guides available
Parking: Small parking lots at major viewpoints

Accessibility: Approachable by good roads; trails and boardwalks inside; limited wheelchair accessibility
Nearby Amenities: Small eateries near entrance; hotels in Gurgaon
Special Notes: Important wintering ground for migratory birds

Type: Lake / Crafts Mela (annual fair) / Cultural destination
Timings: For the craft mela: typically ~10:30 AM–8:30 PM
Best Time to Visit: February (during the Surajkund International Crafts Mela)
Accessibility: Good road connectivity; on-site ramps/assistance usually during mela
Guided Tours: Special tours and curated cultural programs during mela
Nearby Amenities: Ample stalls, food courts during mela, hotels in Faridabad/Delhi

Type: Archaeological Site / Indus Valley Civilization Museum
Official Website: Rakhigarhi museum pages / Hisar district references
Distance (Airport): approx. 60 km or IGI Delhi 150-170 km
Accessibility: Rural roads to the site; minimal facilities; rough terrain
Guided Tours: Archaeological site tours and guided visits arranged during events
Nearby Amenities: Very limited in village — better facilities in Hisar/Jind
Special Notes: One of the largest Indus Valley Civilization urban settlements

Guided Tours: Local guides and history tours available
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, eateries, shops in Panipat city
Special Notes: Panipat’s three historic battle sites are of major national historical importance

Timings: Park & zoo commonly open during daytime
Accessibility: Good city-road access; pathways around lake
Good road access from Jhajjar; limited wheelchair access in rougher areas
Guided Tours: Local birding guides and groups operate guided walks
Special Notes: Important wetland for migratory birds in Haryana

Name of Place: Farrukhnagar — Sheesh Mahal, Baoli & Heritage Sites
Timings: Heritage sites typical daylight visiting hours
Accessibility: Heritage structures may have steps/uneven surfaces — limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Heritage walks organized by INTACH / local agencies occasionally
Parking: Street parking and small lots near monuments
Nearby Amenities: Local bazaar, eateries; proximity to Gurgaon gives wide hotel/restaurant options
Special Notes: Historic salt-trade town with Mughal-era monuments

Timings: Summer: ~4:00 AM to 10:00 PM; Winter: ~5:00 AM to 9:00 PM
Best Time to Visit: Chaitra and Ashwin months (for the Navratri melas)
Accessibility: Good road access; large sprawling temple complex; partial wheelchair access near main entrance
Parking: Ample parking around the temple complex
Nearby Amenities: Bhandara (free meal halls), guest houses/yatri niwas, shops
Special Notes: Very important Shakti shrine; huge numbers of devotees during Navratri

Accessibility: Good road connectivity; limited wheelchair access in engine sheds
Nearby Amenities: Cafeteria, souvenir shop; local restaurants in Rewari town
Special Notes: Only surviving steam locomotive shed in India; houses the Fairy Queen engine

Wikipedia: Not a dedicated detailed Wikipedia page
Accessibility: The palace has been restored; interiors accessible; some parts may have stairs
Guided Tours: Not clearly documented; some heritage walks organized
Special Notes: Hosts the Kartik Cultural Festival every November; beautiful architecture

Distance (Railway): exact nearest railway station: Not documented
Accessibility: Fort sits on top of a hill; road up to a point; then foot-track; stairs / uneven surfaces; minimal wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Not well documented; local guides may be available
Nearby Amenities: Very limited around village; in Mahendragarh town better options
Special Notes: Part of a heritage circuit being developed

Accessibility: Good road connectivity via Karnal city; easy access; likely wheelchair possible
Nearby Amenities: Restaurants, shops, hotels in Karnal city
Special Notes: Lake has folklore (Karna of Mahabharata); ideal for picnics and short stays

Timings: Summer: 06:00 AM to 10:00 AM & 04:00 PM to 07:00 PM
Accessibility: Road access from Yamunanagar; safari tracks of ~16 km motorable; terrain uneven in interior
Guided Tours: Safari routes (jeep) are permitted; local forest department guides likely available
Nearby Amenities: Shivalik foothills surroundings; basic lodgings/tourist rest houses in Yamunanagar
Special Notes: Only natural Sal-forest belt in Haryana; closed during monsoon

Timings: Open during daylight / excavation site access
Accessibility: Rural roads; last-mile access may be via unpaved tracks; not fully wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides / archaeologists may be arranged via Fatehabad tourism
Nearby Amenities: Basic accommodations / guest houses in Fatehabad / Ratia / Bhuna
Special Notes: Very old settlement; shows layers of pre-Harappan and Harappan culture
